content: What is the name of the world's largest ocean, covering more than 60 million square miles and containing more than half of Earth's water?

The name of the world's largest ocean is the Pacific Ocean. It covers an area of over 60 million square miles and contains more than half of Earth's water. The Pacific Ocean stretches from the Arctic in the north to the Southern Ocean in the south and is bounded by Asia and Australia in the west and the Americas in the east. It is larger than the next three largest oceans combined and has a vast influence on global climate and weather patterns.
